      • updateCurrentCustomer

        public void updateCurrentCustomer​(@Valid
                                  @Valid CustomerEntity customerEntity,
                                  java.security.Principal principal)
                           throws NoCustomerFoundException,
                                  KeycloakUnknownErrorException,
                                  KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException,
                                  KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException,
                                  KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException,
                                  CustomerAlreadyExistsException
        Description copied from interface: CustomerServiceI
        Method updates currently authenticated customer entity determined by the principal.
        Specified by:
        updateCurrentCustomer in interface CustomerServiceI
        Parameters:
        customerEntity - customer entity with new details
        principal - principal of spring security context
        Throws:
        NoCustomerFoundException - if no customer could be determined by the principal
        KeycloakUnknownErrorException - if there was any other keycloak error
        KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException - if there is an existing keycloak user with same email
        KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException - if keycloak endpoint was not found
        KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException - if keycloak admin user is not authorized
        CustomerAlreadyExistsException - if there is an existing customer with same email

      • updateCustomer

        public void updateCustomer​(java.lang.String email,
                           @Valid
                           @Valid CustomerEntity customerEntity,
                           CustomerRoleEnum roleOfCallingPrincipal)
                    throws CustomerAlreadyExistsException,
                           KeycloakUnknownErrorException,
                           KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException,
                           KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException,
                           KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException,
                           NoCustomerFoundException,
                           NotAuthorizedException
        Description copied from interface: CustomerServiceI
        Method updates any customer determined by its email.
        Specified by:
        updateCustomer in interface CustomerServiceI
        Parameters:
        email - current customers email
        customerEntity - customer entity with new details
        roleOfCallingPrincipal - role of calling principal
        Throws:
        CustomerAlreadyExistsException - if there is an existing customer with same email
        KeycloakUnknownErrorException - if there was any other keycloak error
        KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException - if there is an existing keycloak user with same email
        KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException - if keycloak endpoint was not found
        KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException - if keycloak admin user is not authorized
        NoCustomerFoundException - if no customer could be determined by the email
        NotAuthorizedException - if caller is not authorized to update the customers details

      • updateCustomer

        public void updateCustomer​(java.lang.String email,
                           @Valid
                           @Valid CustomerEntity customerEntity,
                           CustomerRoleEnum roleOfCallingPrincipal,
                           CustomerRoleEnum targetCustomerRole)
                    throws KeycloakUnknownErrorException,
                           KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException,
                           KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException,
                           KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException,
                           CustomerAlreadyExistsException,
                           NotAuthorizedException,
                           NoCustomerFoundException
        Description copied from interface: CustomerServiceI
        Method updates any customer determined by its email. It also updates the customers role.
        Specified by:
        updateCustomer in interface CustomerServiceI
        Parameters:
        email - current customers email
        customerEntity - customer entity with new details
        roleOfCallingPrincipal - role of calling principal
        targetCustomerRole - new role of customer
        Throws:
        KeycloakUnknownErrorException - if there was any other keycloak error
        KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException - if there is an existing keycloak user with same email
        KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException - if keycloak endpoint was not found
        KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException - if keycloak admin user is not authorized
        CustomerAlreadyExistsException - if there is an existing customer with same email
        NotAuthorizedException - if caller is not authorized to update the customers details
        NoCustomerFoundException - if no customer could be determined by the email

      • deleteCustomer

        public void deleteCustomer​(java.lang.String email,
                           CustomerRoleEnum roleOfCallingPrincipal)
                    throws NoCustomerFoundException,
                           KeycloakUnknownErrorException,
                           KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException,
                           KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException,
                           KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException,
                           NotAuthorizedException
        Description copied from interface: CustomerServiceI
        Method deletes any customer determined by its email.
        Specified by:
        deleteCustomer in interface CustomerServiceI
        Parameters:
        email - current customers email
        roleOfCallingPrincipal - role of calling principal
        Throws:
        NoCustomerFoundException - if no customer could be determined by the email
        KeycloakUnknownErrorException - if there was any other keycloak error
        KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException - if there is an existing keycloak user with same email
        KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException - if keycloak endpoint was not found
        KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException - if keycloak admin user is not authorized
        NotAuthorizedException - if caller is not authorized to delete the customer
